text: Harold Stepney Williams (March 28, 1864, Llanelly – February 24, 1954, Swansea)GENi was the Archdeacon of Gower from 1923Ecclesiastical News The Times (London, England), Wednesday, Oct 10, 1923; pg. 13; Issue 43468 until his death.The Ven. H. S. Williams. The Times (London, England), Thursday, Feb 25, 1954; pg. 8; Issue 52865. Williams was educated at Durham UniversityCrockford's Clerical Directory 1951-52 p 1409 London: OUP, 1951 and ordained in 1888.ECCESIASTICAL INTELLIGENCE Liverpool Mercury (Liverpool, England), Monday, May 28, 1888; Issue 12599 After curacies in Bromborough, TredegarMultiple News Items Nottinghamshire Guardian (London, England), Saturday, September 28, 1889; pg. 5; Issue 2315 and Swansea he was the incumbent at Oystermouth from 1898 until 1938.Welsh Journals On-line ==References== Category:1864 births Category:People from Monmouthshire Category:1954 deaths Category:Alumni of Durham University Category:Archdeacons of Gower
title: Harold Williams (Archdeacon of Gower)
